meanings.definition: Treat (a sacred place or thing) with violent disrespect.
meanings.sent1: The vandals desecrated the church by breaking the stained glass windows.
meanings.sent2: The ancient temple was desecrated by the invaders who defaced the statues.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children desecrated the peaceful garden by trampling the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the historic monument desecrated its solemn beauty.
meanings.sent5: The act of desecrating a sacred site is deeply offensive to many people.

meanings.definition: Violate the sacred character of a place or language.
meanings.sent1: The developers desecrated the forest by clear-cutting the trees.
meanings.sent2: The conquerors desecrated the native language by imposing their own.
meanings.sent3: The prankster desecrated the silence of the library by loudly singing.
meanings.sent4: The noise from the construction site desecrated the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The pollution from the factory desecrated the purity of the river.
